meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, let's get this review party started! I'm stoked to dive into Enhance's Humanity, a puzzle game that's been making waves in the gaming community. But before we get to the good stuff, let me just say that I'm thrilled to be writing about a game that's not, you know, about shooting things or collecting arbitrary power-ups (although, hey, those games are fun too...). Anyway, onto Humanity!

I've got to say, reading through these fancy reviews from critics like IGN, GameSpot, and the rest, I couldn't help but chuckle at some of the hyperbole. "Ambitiously stepping onto new terrain for the action puzzle genre"... um, isn't that just a fancy way of saying it's a puzzle game? Don't get me wrong, I'm all about creativity in gaming, but come on! Let's keep our feet on the ground.

Now, back to Humanity itself. As an avid puzzle fan (yes, I admit it - I love solving stuff!), I was excited to dive into this game and see what all the fuss is about. And let me tell you, it did not disappoint. The gameplay is clever, inventive, and downright charming. You'll be hooked from the get-go, figuring out how to guide those adorable little critters through increasingly complex levels.

What I love most about Humanity is its sheer creativity. From the beautiful, minimalist visuals to the addictive electronic soundtrack (which, by the way, makes for great background music while you're trying to solve puzzles...), this game has a certain je ne sais quoi that sets it apart from other puzzle games out there.

Of course, no puzzle game is perfect, and Humanity's got its own set of quirks. Some levels can be a bit too tricky (read: frustratingly hard), and the hint system could use some fine-tuning (I mean, who doesn't love a good puzzle, but sometimes you just need that extra nudge). Still, these minor complaints don't detract from the overall experience.

In conclusion, Humanity is an absolute must-play for fans of puzzle games. It's a true standout in the genre, offering a unique blend of creativity, charm, and challenge that'll keep you hooked until the very end. So grab some popcorn (or a handful of lemmings...), settle in, and get ready to have your brain tickled by this fantastic little game.

(PS: If any critics out there are reading this, don't worry - I won't bite... hard.)
